answers.answer: Hi there. The changes are age related  and there is disc degeneration at L5 SI disc level with posterior central bulge of  the disc with some thecal or spine indentation. Does he have any compressive nerve symptoms in lower limbs like tingling, numbness, weakness in the lower limbs? Considering his age and morbidity status, he can be given a trial of physiotherapy, as surgery even in the setting of symptoms is not justified. Consult a neurosurgeon for the best relevant judgement. Take care.

question: Our father recently had an MRI done and the following impressions were on his report:1. hypertrophic degenerative changes in bilateral L4-L5 and L5-S1 facet joint with thickening of capsular ligament around them2. posterior central bulge of L5-S1 disc with mild the cal indentationWhat does this mean? Is this serious? Our father is 86 years of age, has diabetes, and has had a kidney transplant in 2000.Please let us know as soon as possible on this matter.thanksToral
title: Is it Degnerative Disc Disease?
